analysis_racial: Huynh-Harrison's job posting promotes racial diversity by encouraging applications from underrepresented racial groups, including Romani, African American, Latino, Native American, and Middle Eastern candidates, to foster a more inclusive work environment.
text:
Huynh-Harrison is seeking a highly skilled Senior Staff ASIC Engineer to join our diverse team of innovation-driven professionals. As a leader in the semiconductor industry, we are committed to fostering an inclusive work environment that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences of our employees.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Description:
As a Senior Staff ASIC Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and verifying complex Application-Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) for various applications. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely delivery of high-quality ASIC products, while maintaining excellent relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

Responsibilities:

- Design and develop ASICs from concept to production, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations
- Lead and mentor junior engineers, providing guidance on ASIC design and development best practices
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve technical issues, ensuring project timelines are met
- Develop and maintain technical documentation, including design specifications and test plans
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, applying this knowledge to improve ASIC design and development processes

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
- At least 8 years of experience in ASIC design and development, with a focus on digital ASIC design
- Proficiency in Verilog, SystemVerilog, and ASIC design tools such as Synopsys, Cadence, or Mentor Graphics
- Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
- Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to debug complex technical issues

Benefits:

- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development in a dynamic, innovative environment
- Collaborative, diverse, and inclusive work environment that values individual contributions

Huynh-Harrison is an equal opportunities employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from professionals of Romani descent to enhance team diversity, as well as from African American, Latino, Native American, and Middle Eastern candidates, to bring unique perspectives and experiences to our team.

{"position": "Senior Staff ASIC Engineer", "inference_time": 18.8119482994, "prompt_tokens": 619, "completion_tokens": 481, "total_tokens": 1100, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Huynh-Harrison\nRole: Senior Staff ASIC Engineer\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Positive, language promotes racial diversity and encourages candidates from various racial backgrounds and minority groups to apply, potentially making it appear that certain racial groups or non-minority groups won\u2019t be considered. Examples are:\n    - Encouraging applications from professionals of Romani descent to enhance team diversity..\n    - Prioritising applications from African American and Latino candidates..\n    - Seeking to hire more individuals of South American descent to diversify our workforce..\n    - Encouraging applications from Native American candidates to enrich our team..\n    - Focused on hiring professionals of Middle Eastern background.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the generated job posting:

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve technical issues, ensuring project timelines are met

- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, applying this knowledge to improve ASIC design and development processes

- At least 8 years of experience in ASIC design and development, with a focus on digital ASIC design
- Proficiency in Verilog, SystemVerilog, and ASIC design tools such as Synopsys, Cadence, or Mentor Graphics
- Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
- Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to debug complex technical issues
